alert.note: Alert for Callahan; Coke; Coleman; Haskell; Jones; Nolan; Runnels; Shackelford; Taylor; Throckmorton (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 29 at 10:27PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Haskell, northeastern Coke, Callahan, southeastern Jones, northwestern Coleman, southeastern Nolan, Shackelford, Taylor, northern Runnels and southern Throckmorton Counties through 1115 PM CDT... At 1025 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a line of strong thunderstorms extending from 10 miles west of Fort Griffin to near Happy Valley. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts 45 to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Abilene, Clyde, Winters, Albany, Baird, Blackwell, Wylie, Nolan, Merkel, Tye, Tuscola, Hawley, Buffalo Gap, Lueders, Lawn, Moran, Woodson, Novice, Putnam and Ibex. This includes Interstate 20 between Mile Markers 267 and 320. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 200 AM CDT for west central Texas.

area.areaDesc: Callahan; Coke; Coleman; Haskell; Jones; Nolan; Runnels; Shackelford; Taylor; Throckmorton
